text: The King Living 1977 Sofa reinterprets a classic with modern ingenuity, striking a balance between timeless aesthetics and contemporary functionality. Rooted in the modularity of its 1970s predecessor, this refined version integrates advanced materials, ergonomic engineering, and a deep understanding of evolving living spaces. The result is a sectional designed not just for seating but for seamless adaptation to modern lifestyles. Designer: King Living Aesthetic Fluidity with a Nod to the Past Inspired by the first King Living Sofa, the 1977 model maintains the original’s low-slung form and inviting curves. Its sculpted profile exudes a relaxed sophistication, where sweeping contours and subtle detailing create a silhouette that feels effortless. The design embraces an understated elegance, making it as fitting for a minimal loft as it is for a carefully curated living room. By maintaining a clean, architectural presence, the sofa achieves the rare feat of standing out without overwhelming its surroundings. The use of premium upholstery fabrics further accentuates its refined character. Whether opting for the textured depth of bouclé or the structured appeal of quilted textiles, each fabric choice enhances the sofa’s tactile experience. Modular customization extends beyond configuration—the ability to update covers provides longevity and aesthetic versatility, ensuring that the 1977 remains relevant across evolving trends. Ergonomic Innovation for Lasting Comfort King Living integrates precision engineering with human-centric design. The 1977 Sofa’s comfort is not simply about plush cushions—it’s the result of meticulous attention to support and pressure distribution. At its core, the Postureflex Seating System mirrors the suspension technologies found in high-end automotive seating, offering a level of resilience that adapts to movement while maintaining structural integrity. The layered multi-density foam ensures a seating experience that remains inviting without compromising spinal alignment. The waterfall seat edges alleviate pressure on the legs, while the backrest’s gentle curvature supports natural posture. Modularity extends to ergonomics. Adjustable armrests, reconfigurable seating arrangements, and adaptable chaise placement allow users to fine-tune their setup for optimal relaxation. Whether positioned for lounging, entertaining, or working from home, the 1977 Sofa transitions effortlessly. Material Integrity and Sustainable Craftsmanship Designed for durability, the King Steel Frame serves as the foundation for longevity. Crafted from recyclable steel and backed by a 25-year warranty, the frame ensures structural resilience without excess weight. The powder-coated finish resists corrosion, further reinforcing the sofa’s enduring nature. Washable, replaceable covers extend the lifespan of the upholstery while reducing waste. Every fabric selection undergoes extensive durability testing, ensuring colorfastness and resistance to wear over time. This sustainable approach is complemented by CFC-free foam, aligning with eco-conscious design principles that prioritize health and environmental responsibility. A Modular System for Evolving Spaces Adaptability is the defining feature of the 1977 Sofa. Each module connects seamlessly, allowing configurations that suit various layouts—from intimate two-seaters to expansive sectionals. The flexibility to reposition elements without compromising aesthetic coherence sets it apart, making it an ideal choice for dynamic interiors. A concealed connection system keeps transitions between modules visually uninterrupted, maintaining the sofa’s sculptural appeal. This emphasis on adaptability extends to the way people interact with their living spaces. As homes increasingly serve multiple functions, furniture must cater to shifting needs. The 1977 Sofa embodies this shift, delivering a piece that evolves with its user rather than remaining static. Few furniture pieces achieve a balance of heritage and innovation, quite like the 1977 Sofa. It’s not simply a sectional—it’s an evolving platform for comfort, aesthetics, and adaptability. Focused on craftsmanship, ergonomics, and sustainable design, King Living continues to push the boundaries of modular furniture, creating a timeless centerpiece for contemporary spaces.

The King Living 1977 Sofa reinterprets a classic with modern ingenuity, striking a balance between timeless aesthetics and contemporary functionality. Rooted in the modularity of its 1970s predecessor, this refined version integrates advanced materials, ergonomic engineering, and a deep understanding of evolving living spaces. The result is a sectional designed not just for seating but for seamless adaptation to modern lifestyles.

Designer: King Living

Aesthetic Fluidity with a Nod to the Past

Inspired by the first King Living Sofa, the 1977 model maintains the original’s low-slung form and inviting curves. Its sculpted profile exudes a relaxed sophistication, where sweeping contours and subtle detailing create a silhouette that feels effortless. The design embraces an understated elegance, making it as fitting for a minimal loft as it is for a carefully curated living room. By maintaining a clean, architectural presence, the sofa achieves the rare feat of standing out without overwhelming its surroundings.

The use of premium upholstery fabrics further accentuates its refined character. Whether opting for the textured depth of bouclé or the structured appeal of quilted textiles, each fabric choice enhances the sofa’s tactile experience. Modular customization extends beyond configuration—the ability to update covers provides longevity and aesthetic versatility, ensuring that the 1977 remains relevant across evolving trends.

Ergonomic Innovation for Lasting Comfort

King Living integrates precision engineering with human-centric design. The 1977 Sofa’s comfort is not simply about plush cushions—it’s the result of meticulous attention to support and pressure distribution.

At its core, the Postureflex Seating System mirrors the suspension technologies found in high-end automotive seating, offering a level of resilience that adapts to movement while maintaining structural integrity. The layered multi-density foam ensures a seating experience that remains inviting without compromising spinal alignment. The waterfall seat edges alleviate pressure on the legs, while the backrest’s gentle curvature supports natural posture.

Modularity extends to ergonomics. Adjustable armrests, reconfigurable seating arrangements, and adaptable chaise placement allow users to fine-tune their setup for optimal relaxation. Whether positioned for lounging, entertaining, or working from home, the 1977 Sofa transitions effortlessly.

Material Integrity and Sustainable Craftsmanship

Designed for durability, the King Steel Frame serves as the foundation for longevity. Crafted from recyclable steel and backed by a 25-year warranty, the frame ensures structural resilience without excess weight. The powder-coated finish resists corrosion, further reinforcing the sofa’s enduring nature.

Washable, replaceable covers extend the lifespan of the upholstery while reducing waste. Every fabric selection undergoes extensive durability testing, ensuring colorfastness and resistance to wear over time. This sustainable approach is complemented by CFC-free foam, aligning with eco-conscious design principles that prioritize health and environmental responsibility.

A Modular System for Evolving Spaces

Adaptability is the defining feature of the 1977 Sofa. Each module connects seamlessly, allowing configurations that suit various layouts—from intimate two-seaters to expansive sectionals. The flexibility to reposition elements without compromising aesthetic coherence sets it apart, making it an ideal choice for dynamic interiors. A concealed connection system keeps transitions between modules visually uninterrupted, maintaining the sofa’s sculptural appeal.

This emphasis on adaptability extends to the way people interact with their living spaces. As homes increasingly serve multiple functions, furniture must cater to shifting needs. The 1977 Sofa embodies this shift, delivering a piece that evolves with its user rather than remaining static.

Few furniture pieces achieve a balance of heritage and innovation, quite like the 1977 Sofa. It’s not simply a sectional—it’s an evolving platform for comfort, aesthetics, and adaptability. Focused on craftsmanship, ergonomics, and sustainable design, King Living continues to push the boundaries of modular furniture, creating a timeless centerpiece for contemporary spaces.
